intro: Sarcodraba andina, commonly known as the Andean sarcodraba, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
